issues.description: The template Stock.getStockIngredients() returns a List<StockIngredient> while the solution's Stock.getStockIngredients() returns a StockIngredient[] and the Stock.stock field is declared as StockIngredient[]. The problem statement asks students to “add getters for all the private fields” (which implies a getter matching the field type). This mismatch between the template and the solution (and the implicit expectation from the problem text) can confuse students about the expected getter return type and lead to inconsistent usage (array vs. List) when implementing or testing their solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the getter return type consistent with the private field and the solution. Change the template's Stock.getStockIngredients() signature to return StockIngredient[] (and adjust its implementation accordingly) so it matches the field type StockIngredient[] and the solution. Alternatively, update the problem statement to explicitly accept a List<StockIngredient> getter and update the solution to match, but the simpler fix is to change the template getter to StockIngredient[].
